question.questionA: Fruit less than ten times as long as broad.
question.questionB: Fruit more than ten times as long as broad.

question.questionA: Plants glaucous; flowers white, lilac or purple.
Capsules  less  than  twice  as  long  as broad; hairs at right angles to pedicel.
question.questionB: Capsules more than twice as long as broad; hairs adpressed to pedicel.

question.questionA: Leaves pinnately divided with broad oblong segments; petals scarlet; capsule more than three times as long as broad.
question.questionB: Leaves irregularly divided with narrow linear segments; petals crimson; capsule globular.

question.questionA: Sap orange; flowers two or more together, petals up to 1 cm.
question.questionB: Sap white; flowers solitary, petals 2 cm or more.

question.questionA: Petals yellow; anthers yellow; stem and capsule glabrous.
question.questionB: Petals scarlet; anthers violet; stem and capsules hairy.

question.questionA: Leaves glaucous, leaflets very narrow, channelled.
Raceme lax with eight to twelve flowers.
question.questionB: Raceme dense, usually with at least fifteen flowers.

question.questionA: Corolla 6-7 mm; bracts normally exceeding fruiting pedicels.
question.questionB: Corolla 3 mm or less; bracts shorter than fruiting pedicels.
